subject: refactor(terminology): remove all traces of 'tags' — labels is the only term
body:
No backwards-compat, no aliases. The word 'tags' no longer exists anywhere
in src/. Import services only accept 'labels'. Database schema collapsed
to a single clean version with no legacy migration path.

Changes:
- importExportService: buildLabelsFromRaw only reads `labels` field,
  removed all `tags` parsing. CSV auto-suggest no longer detects `tags`
  column.
- markdownImportService: extractLabels only reads `labels` frontmatter,
  extractProperties only reserves `labels` key.
- database.ts: collapsed 3 Dexie versions into 1 clean schema (no legacy
  v1 with *tags, no v2/v3 migration chain).
- Tests: all mock data uses `labels`, removed tags-specific compat tests.
- types/index.ts: removed 'tags' from comment.
- Docs: removed last tags reference from AI guide CSV section and CLAUDE.md.

Tags: terminology, consistency, labels, cleanup
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 3
Impact: internal
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: import-compatibility
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GmBxqTbwGYpy2GUF4TGDLk
title: remove all traces of 'tags' — labels is the only term
